article:
The Summer Olympics, the Winter Olympics and even the Paralympics are popular all over the world. However, there's still a very   _  Deaflympics, in which matches don't   _  shooting and arrow.
In the years before 1924, international sports offered   _   chances for young Deaf people. In fact, there were very few national organizations to   _   sporting competitions for the Deaf. Mr. Eugene Rubens -- Alcais, a Deaf Frenchman, worked very hard to   _   six official national organizations to accept the idea and to take part in the International   _   Games, a deaf version of the Olympics Games. 
Deaf sporting leaders   _   together at the Cafe de la Porte Doree, 275 Avenue Daumesnil, near the Bois de Vincennes in Paris on the 16th August,1924. This meeting agreed to   _   up an organization called the "International Committee of Silent Sports"(CISS) to   _   a union between all Deaf sporting federations and to produce some   _   for this organization to institute and control the every--four--year Games. This historic meeting   _   so much to the Deaflympic Games moment that the first Games was held in Paris in 1924, making it the oldest among the disabled sports organizations. It also   _   official recognition and help from the International Olympic Committee.
The first Winter Deaflympic Games (formerly named International Winter Silent Games and Winter World Deaf Games) were   _    in Seefeld, Austria in 1949. Thirty--three   _   from five nations took part. And today, more and more deaf people are   _   to take part in this Game.
